data.title: A new button to ask for help (from another player)
data.body:
What about adding a new button to ask for help from other players of the same team ?

Clicking on this button would change the mouse cursor and the player could point out a position on the battlefield. At the same time, other players would see a flashing red dot in their minimap.

Also, mayne there could be a notification (text message):
"Player Scott requires your assistance at the location shown on the minimap."

data.title: Units having different sizes inside of transports.
data.body:
IE: Ranger takes up 3 spaces, Light Tank 4 spaces etc.

This will also improve water transports, give them more pips but then introduce this system. So you can't just load up 5APC's with 5 guys each and be able to get 25 infantry into a transport whereas if you just loaded individual infantry you can only have 5 in it.
So give the water transport 12 squares or something, APC takes up 4

Would be cool if this would allow Chinooks to carry certain vehicles such as a single Ranger or Artillery. (or even if Chinooks could work like a carryall?)

data.title: Windows dependency download is error prone
data.body: our No. 1 https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/FAQ entry. This should go away as it breaks the first time experience badly for the majority of retro-gamers out there. We could simply bundle all the DLLs inside the NSIS installer to avoid this.

data.title: Use GitHub releases
data.body:
https://github.com/blog/1547-release-your-software

Advantage is that we use the GitHub CDN instead of just our donated web server. Might not be fully automatizable though.

data.title: AI will try hunt down cloaked units it can't attack
data.body:
decreasing the performance dramatically, introduced/revealed by #3726.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/870076-ai-will-try-hunt-down-cloaked-units-it-can-t-attack?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Let the AI not command stolen units and brought back the Deviator tank
data.body: extracted from #3691, fixes #2347 properly.

data.title: Fixes TS mod crash when trying to change color due to missing fact.shp
data.body: Note: shp preview doesn't remap yet, that seems to require another fix.

data.title: Building auto repair if player has over X credits.
data.body:
An option for building auto repair would be quite nice. Have an option somewhere to set how much money a player wants to have saved up before stuff will auto-repair. 

IE: Set your amount to 2500, if you have 4000 credits and a building gets damage it will start to repair on its own.

data.title: Team defaults to 0 when player leaves
data.body:
Both
- CncConquestObjectivesLogic
- ObserverStatsLogic

are affected.

data.title: Repair pad pathfinding
data.body:
In all mods when I use the Repair pad and set a waypoint somewhere and the repaired vehicle finds a single blocking unit or building in its linear path it just simply stop and don't move anymore unless I give it a new order.

Perhaps it is related to the path finding algorithm which has also many issues. Some unit stop moving in a large group even it has enough space to do it.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/865206-repair-pad-pathfinding?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: d2k factory animations always on
data.body:
The factory animations (flashes in the hangar) are always on regardless of the building orders. They should be only active when we build something in it.
Affected: Light factory, heavy factory, High tech facility.

The High tech facility should be off I think because we still don't have Carryals to build inside of them.

data.title: d2k radar / outpost animation
data.body:
When we shut down the outpost or have low power the radar animation should stop.
Currently the radar dish is still rotating.

data.title: d2k construction yard animation
data.body: In the original game we had an animation at the construction yard when we placed down a building. The animation is missing from the current playtest.

data.title: Trouble running on OS X
data.body:
I've cloned the git repo, and followed the [instructions for OS X](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Mac-OS-X) and copied the third party DLLs into the root directory.

I can `make clean && make all` fine, but when I attempt to run the game via `mono OpenRA.Game.exe`, the loading screen starts up fine (with messages in the bottom right such as _Aging empires_), but then the game crashes with...

> Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Error creating framebuffer
>   at OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.FrameBuffer..ctor (Size size) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.SdlGraphics.CreateFrameBuffer (Size s) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Graphics.VoxelRenderer.AllocateSheet () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Graphics.SheetBuilder..ctor (SheetType t, System.Func`1 allocateSheet) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Graphics.VoxelRenderer.BeginFrame () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.GenerateRenderables () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.Draw () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Graphics.Viewport.DrawRegions (OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer wr, IInputHandler inputHandler) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Game.Tick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager, OpenRA.Graphics.Viewport viewPort) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
>   at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

I don't know too much about OpenRA's code yet, so I haven't been able to diagnose it myself.

If I download the OS X build from the main site, it works fine.

Does anyone know what I've done wrong?

data.title: Further TS mod improvements
data.body: Basic Nod tech tree, more cursor sequences, improved factory exit.

data.title: Mouse gestures
data.body:
It could be interesting to be able to use Mouse Gestures for the following commands: Sell, Powerdown and Repair.

Even if it increases chances of success, I doubt many players use hotkeys (F10-F11-F12) for these commands (it could be interesting to create a poll). Of course, they should use them, it's fast but I really doubt they do it often.

Another fast method to accomplish these commands would be to support "mouse gestures". The player would have to select the building and move his cursor over it.

To avoid errors, gestures would be really distinct:
- Sell: 
  circular movement (1 pass or 2 passes for security)
  ![circular_new](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1075455/4919d96a-14ce-11e3-8c51-93985d943a28.gif)
- Powerdown: 
  horizontal movement (3 passes: left to right, rigth to left, left to right)
  ![horizontal_new](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1075461/5452a942-14ce-11e3-9fab-d62a578d0c8d.gif)
- Repair: 
  vertical movement (3 passes: down to up, up to down, down to up)
  ![vertical_new](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1075467/65ecdfb0-14ce-11e3-9ebd-3442c3e2910f.gif)

data.title: admin shall have to power to decide the teams
data.body:
I think it would be wise to give the admin the power to decide about the teams and maybe even te starting spots (spawns) of the players. Not JUST the admin, but he shall be able to change some players teams. 
This would make it more easy to organize the game

data.title: RA: Remove bib from buildings that don't require it.
data.body: It looks bad, and gives an advantage to base walking in a northern/southern direction by artificially increasing the size of the building.

data.title: Repair a building faster if several players are using the Repair button on it
data.body:
This is a question and also a feature request, if it's not yet supported.

Does a building that is being repaired by two players at the same time, get its health increasing faster ?

data.title: Add rsync support
data.body:
Hello.

I suggest to add rsync support on "http://content.open-ra.org/users/", "http://openra.res0l.net/packages/" and "http://openra.res0l.net/releases/" to be able to sync this data automatically.

For example "http://openra.dxnet.ru" will be able to sync automatically with "http://openra.res0l.net/packages/"

data.title: Rewrite ShpTSReader
data.body: The current code is pretty nasty. http://www.ppmsite.com/forum/download.php?id=39587 contains the format details.

data.title: D2K content download is broken (bleed)

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Two issues:
1. Total size is shown as 0 while downloading.
2. 'Invalid archive' error consistently produced after ~10M, making the game unplayable.

data.title: Ported Terrain parser to StreamReader extensions
data.body: Again the idea is this adds consistency and might help with #2441.

data.title: Started the Ingame Map Editor
data.body: not too impressive, but we have to start somewhere for #3377 I guess. This currently only allows to edit meta-data.

data.title: Ported AudLoader to StreamExts
data.body: Hope this helps with #2441 or something.

data.title: Added [Sync] checks for projectile effects
data.body: to investigate the desync in #3697 and others hiding in the combat code.

data.title: HackyAI refactoring
data.body:
This starts cleaning up HackyAI with the goal of removing some of the code warts and making it more maintainable.
This avoids introducing any (intentional) behavioral changes - these will be done in later PRs.

data.title: Dropped support for ancient Mono versions
data.body: in fact you can't compile and run OpenRA on them without problems already. This just makes it official.

data.title: Wired up OnDoubleClick for the ModBrowser.
data.body: as requested in #3166
